vision.notes: Turacos are noted for unique pigments giving them bright green and red feathers. This indicates well-developed color vision, likely important for identifying ripe fruit and for communication. They have open or nearly-open eyes at birth.

audition.notes: Many species are noisy, with go-away-birds noted for piercing alarm calls. Crinifer piscator has a loud cow-cow-cow call, which is very familiar in west Africa. This suggests well-developed hearing for communication and predator detection.

taste/gustation.notes: All species are frugivorous, eating leaves, buds, and flowers. Figs are an important part of their diet. This implies a functional sense of taste for identifying food sources.

touch/tactition.notes: They build large stick nests in trees, and the young are born with thick down, suggesting a developed sense of touch is crucial for nest building and parental care.
